xwikidoc.name: medsavantArchive20130611
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 11 June 2013
xwikidoc.content: <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 09:04 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 11:36 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 11:59 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 11:59 <sdumitriu> Hello bvancea 12:00 <bvancea> hello sdumitriu 12:00 <bvancea> how are you? 12:01 <sdumitriu> A bit bummed that I can't get an Windows8 machine to boot Linux 12:01 <bvancea> hmm 12:01 <bvancea> because of the loader? 12:01 <sdumitriu> No idea 12:02 <sdumitriu> UEFI doesn't find my bootloader 12:02 <sdumitriu> And I tried a bunch 12:02 <sdumitriu> I'll keep trying when I get back home 12:03 <bvancea> is it a your personal machine? 12:03 <sdumitriu> Yes 12:03 <bvancea> nice 12:03 <bvancea> laptop? 12:03 <sdumitriu> Yes 12:05 <bvancea> sucks that you're having so many problems with the dual boot 12:07 <sdumitriu> I'm trying even mono boot 12:07 <sdumitriu> But now it can't boot anything 12:08 <bvancea> that's weird 12:08 <bvancea> what model is it? 12:14 <sdumitriu> http://www.bestbuy.ca/en-CA/product/samsung-samsung-series-7-13-3-ultrabook-silver-intel-core-i5-3337um-256gb-ssd-8gb-ram-windows-8-np740u3e-a02ca/10238261.aspx?path=609cedec812f495f65ab1e7534666052en02&SearchPageIndex=1 12:17 <bvancea> hmm, looks nice 12:17 <bvancea> I've heard trying to disable secure boot might bricks some series of samsung laptops 12:17 <bvancea> brick* 12:18 <sdumitriu> No, that worked fine 12:18 <sdumitriu> I can boot from an external USB stick 12:19 <bvancea> I see 12:19 <bvancea> well, hopefully you can get it to boot 12:19 <bvancea> what dist are you using? 12:28 <sdumitriu> Gentoo 12:29 <bvancea> nice 12:29 <bvancea> I've used Ubuntu mostly 12:29 <bvancea> but the last few versions made me sad 12:30 <bvancea> not even to the laptop fan works properly 12:33 <bvancea> anyway, I've connected to the ICE database on the dev server 12:34 <bvancea> could seem to get the medsavant client to connect to it 12:34 <bvancea> and trying to export the database didn't get me far 12:34 <bvancea> the community edition for infobright doesnt support insert/update/delete 12:35 <sdumitriu> It should 12:35 <bvancea> not sure how people are supposed to use it 12:35 <sdumitriu> What did you try to do? 12:35 <bvancea> for the database? or the medsavant client? 12:36 <sdumitriu> For the database 12:36 <bvancea> connected using mysql workbench 12:36 <bvancea> exported one of the databases into an .sql file 12:36 <bvancea> and then tried to import it locally 12:36 <bvancea> both from the command line client 12:36 <bvancea> and mysql workbench 12:37 <bvancea> apparently it should only work if you're loading one file at a time, in bulk 12:38 <marta> has left #medsavant 12:39 <marta> has joined #medsavant 14:19 <bvancea> its so weird I can't find an infobright database back-up script atleast 14:19 <bvancea> I guess there's more people using the enterprise edition 14:20 <sdumitriu> Or there's nobody using any edition... 14:21 <bvancea> could be 14:33 <bvancea> I wonder if I could maybe access the database from my local server 14:35 <bvancea> I mean, if I try to connect my local server engine to that database 14:35 <bvancea> is the database only accessible over ssh? 14:37 <sdumitriu> I doubt it 14:37 <sdumitriu> I think it 14:37 <sdumitriu> 's firewalled 14:44 <bvancea> hmm 14:44 <bvancea> I'll try to install a trial of the enterprice edition 14:45 <sdumitriu> But wait 14:45 <bvancea> hm? 14:45 <sdumitriu> If you have the database dump, can't you just import it into a simple mysql instance? 14:45 <sdumitriu> Forget about ICE 14:46 <bvancea> hmm 14:46 <sdumitriu> The only advantage is that it compresses data 14:46 <bvancea> okay, I'll try that 14:46 <sdumitriu> But it's still a MySQL 14:46 <bvancea> I see 14:46 <bvancea> I thought it has extra stuff 15:12 <bvancea> yay, it works 15:12 <sdumitriu> :) 15:12 <bvancea> now I just need to find the database with the most information 15:12 <bvancea> there's like 30-40 databases there 15:13 <bvancea> should I ask on the development list which is the most populated? 15:14 <sdumitriu> No, that's not quite development 15:14 <sdumitriu> Ask Marc 15:15 <bvancea> okay, I'll send an email to him 15:15 <sdumitriu> But I guess you can take one randomly for the moment, and look into it 15:15 <bvancea> I opened like 10 of them 15:16 <bvancea> and took the dumps to those which seemed to have both patients and variants 15:16 <bvancea> I have 2 dumps 15:16 <bvancea> but one has 1 patient, the other has 4 15:17 <bvancea> well,it might suffice 16:49 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 17:02 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 18:42 <marta> has joined #medsavant 21:00 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 22:46 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant
